coredata.dc:title: Parallelization of ant system for GPU under the PRAM model
coredata.dc:publisher:
Slovak Academy of Sciences
Dubravska cesta 9 Bratislava 845 07

abstract.publishercopyright: © Slovak Academy of Sciences - Institute of Informatics.
abstract.ce:para: We study the parallelized ant system algorithm solving the traveling salesman problem on n cities. First, following the series of recent results for the graphics processing unit, we show that they translate to the PRAM (parallel random access machine) model. In addition, we develop a novel pheromone matrix update method under the PRAM CREW (concurrent-read exclusive-write) model and translate it to the graphics processing unit without atomic instructions. As a consequence, we give new asymptotic bounds for the parallel ant system, resulting in step complexities 0(n lglgn) on CRCW (concurrent-read concurrent-write) and O(nlgn) on CREW variants of PRAM using n 2 processors in both cases. Finally, we present an experimental comparison with the currently known pheromone matrix update methods on the graphics processing unit and obtain encouraging results.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2019 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

citation-title.titletext: Parallelization of ant system for GPU under the PRAM model

affiliation.organization: Department of Information Science and Technology

abstract.ce:para: We study the parallelized ant system algorithm solving the traveling salesman problem on n cities. First, following the series of recent results for the graphics processing unit, we show that they translate to the PRAM (parallel random access machine) model. In addition, we develop a novel pheromone matrix update method under the PRAM CREW (concurrent-read exclusive-write) model and translate it to the graphics processing unit without atomic instructions. As a consequence, we give new asymptotic bounds for the parallel ant system, resulting in step complexities 0(n lglgn) on CRCW (concurrent-read concurrent-write) and O(nlgn) on CREW variants of PRAM using n 2 processors in both cases. Finally, we present an experimental comparison with the currently known pheromone matrix update methods on the graphics processing unit and obtain encouraging results.

classification.classification-description: Combinatorial Mathematics, Includes Graph Theory, Set Theory
